post.author: Kelly J Lee
post.content:
Meeting Announcement
Topic:  MSDN Canada User Group Tour:  Visual Studio 2005

When? Thursday, June 16th , 6:00 p.m. – 9:00 p.m.

Where? Microsoft Canada , 1950 Meadowvale Blvd , Mississauga (north of 401 at Mississauga Road exit)

How Do I Register?  See Instructions at end of e-mail.

OVERVIEW:  These tours are BIG and sell out FAST! Sign up now for the latest information on Visual Studio 2005 Beta 2! Food and beverages will be provided. Lots of prize giveaways!

Register NOW, but only if you will definitely commit to attend!   Our events typically fill to capacity, and registration will close as soon as the event is full.

Time
Description

6:00 p.m.
Meet and greet!  Arrive early!   Food and Drink!!

6:30 p.m.
Opening Remarks

6:45 p.m.
Visual Studio 2005 – Beta 2:  

Microsoft Visual Studio 2005, code named Whidbey, is one of the most anticipated technical software releases of 2005. In this talk, we will review the major new enhancements to Visual Studio 2005, along with a hands on demo of these powerful new features. Whether you are a developer, architect or tester, there are great new features that promise to make your life easier and improve your productivity. Enhancements to Visual Basic .NET, C#, and C++ along with the core enhancements to the .NET framework will simplify and streamline your development process, regardless if you are developing client, server, mobile based or web services based solutions. Come learn more about Visual Studio 2005 to enhance your personal use of the Beta 2 release.

8:15 p.m.
Wrap up and Prizes!




SPONSOR MESSAGE:  Navantis is very proud to sponsor the Toronto .NET User Group. We look forward to contributing to the .NET user dialogue and to sharing best practices and our development expertise with members. As a Microsoft Gold Certified Partner and an award winning provider of premium IT professional services, Navantis designs, develops and deploys innovative business solutions developed using the .NET framework for some of North America’s largest organizations including; Honda, CIBC, Microsoft, CBC, Magna Entertainment Corporation, The City of Hamilton and Allstate Insurance. Our mission is simple; to deliver exceptional client service and quality every step of the way. We are always seeking passionate, client-focused and exceptionally talented individuals who share our philosophy to join our team. Please visit us at www.navantis.com




VERY IMPORTANT NOTE – BEFORE YOU REGISTER:

While the meetings are FREE to you, the meetings cost real money on the part of our sponsors to put on, in the order of thousands of dollars.  When you register, we are spending money on YOU, by reserving a place, and ordering food.  So please make your registration an absolute and unwavering commitment to attend!

HOW TO REGISTER:

1.       We prefer you register on the web at http://www.torontoug.net

2.       PLEASE we need your registration if you are going to attend!  We need to know how many will come so that we can book the appropriate number of event rooms and order adequate food.  We are regularly selling out meetings with over 200 people attending, so be sure to register early!!

3.       If you are a member, please Login!  If you are not yet a member, click “Register”.  There is NO COST to join.

4.       If you have logged in or just signed up as a new member this DOES NOT automatically sign you up for the event!

5.       Please go to the “User Group Events” section, and click on the “Read More” to see the event details.  You will see the “Click here to register” link.  There is NO COST to attend the meeting!

6.       If all else fails, please contact Ed Musters at 416-817-3330 and leave a message.

The Toronto .NET User Group currently has well over 3,000 registered members, making it one of the largest in North America!  Thank you to all for your tremendous support.

Ed Musters, President
Toronto .NET User Group
post.title: Toronto .NET usergroup Meeting Announcement
